abstract: 1. The concentrations of sodium, potassium, calcium, magnesium, chloride as well as pH and osmolality were measured in the hemolymph of the land-snail Crytomphallus aspersa. 2. Potassium, calcium, and magnesium concentrations show great variations. 3. A saline for Pulmonata conveniently replacing hemolymph is described.
